org.platanios.learn.combination.error

Interface ObjectiveFunction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DependencyObjectiveFunction

    public interface ObjectiveFunction
    An interface specifying the methods that all classes defined as possible objective functions for the numerical optimization problem involved in the error rates estimation process should implement.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computeGradient(double[] optimizationVariables, double[] optimizationObjectiveGradients)
      Computes the first derivatives of the objective function and the constraints at a particular point.
      void computeHessian(double[] optimizationVariables, double[] optimizationHessian)
      Computes the Hessian of the Lagrangian at a particular point.
      void computeObjective(double[] optimizationVariables, double[] optimizationObjective)
      Computes the objective value and the constraints values at a particular point.

    • Method Detail

      • computeObjective

        void computeObjective(double[] optimizationVariables,
                      double[] optimizationObjective)
        Computes the objective value and the constraints values at a particular point.
        Parameters:
        optimizationVariables - The point in which to evaluate the objective function and the constraints.
        optimizationObjective - The objective value to set for the given point.

      • computeGradient

        void computeGradient(double[] optimizationVariables,
                     double[] optimizationObjectiveGradients)
        Computes the first derivatives of the objective function and the constraints at a particular point.
        Parameters:
        optimizationVariables - The point in which to evaluate the derivatives.
        optimizationObjectiveGradients - The objective function gradients vector to modify.

      • computeHessian

        void computeHessian(double[] optimizationVariables,
                    double[] optimizationHessian)
        Computes the Hessian of the Lagrangian at a particular point. The constraints in this case are linear and so they do not contribute to the Hessian value.
        Parameters:
        optimizationVariables - The point in which to evaluate the Hessian.
        optimizationHessian - The Hessian (in sparse/vector form) to modify.
